parameters.description: Boolean which defines whether brief representations are returned (default: false)

parameters.description: A String contained in email, or the complete email, if param "exact" is true

parameters.name: emailVerified
parameters.description: whether the email has been verified

parameters.name: enabled
parameters.description: Boolean representing if user is enabled or not

parameters.name: exact
parameters.description: Boolean which defines whether the params "last", "first", "email" and "username" must match exactly

parameters.name: firstName
parameters.description: A String contained in firstName, or the complete firstName, if param "exact" is true

parameters.name: idpAlias
parameters.description: The alias of an Identity Provider linked to the user

parameters.name: idpUserId
parameters.description: The userId at an Identity Provider linked to the user

parameters.name: lastName
parameters.description: A String contained in lastName, or the complete lastName, if param "exact" is true

parameters.name: q
parameters.description: A query to search for custom attributes, in the format 'key1:value2 key2:value2'

parameters.name: search
parameters.description: A String contained in username, first or last name, or email. Default search behavior is prefix-based (e.g., foo or foo*). Use *foo* for infix search and "foo" for exact search.

parameters.name: username
parameters.description: A String contained in username, or the complete username, if param "exact" is true

get.summary: Returns the number of users that match the given criteria.
get.description:
It can be called in three different ways. 1. Dont specify any criteria and pass {@code null}. The number of all users within that realm will be returned.

2. If {@code search} is specified other criteria such as {@code last} will be ignored even though you set them. The {@code search} string will be matched against the first and last name, the username and the email of a user.

3. If {@code search} is unspecified but any of {@code last}, {@code first}, {@code email} or {@code username} those criteria are matched against their respective fields on a user entity. Combined with a logical and.

parameters.name: email
parameters.description: A String contained in email, or the complete email, if param "exact" is true

parameters.name: emailVerified
parameters.description: whether the email has been verified

parameters.name: enabled
parameters.description: Boolean representing if user is enabled or not

parameters.name: exact
parameters.description: Boolean which defines whether the params "last", "first", "email" and "username" must match exactly

parameters.name: firstName
parameters.description: A String contained in firstName, or the complete firstName, if param "exact" is true

parameters.name: idpAlias
parameters.description: The alias of an Identity Provider linked to the user

parameters.name: idpUserId
parameters.description: The userId at an Identity Provider linked to the user

parameters.name: lastName
parameters.description: A String contained in lastName, or the complete lastName, if param "exact" is true

parameters.name: q
parameters.description: A query to search for custom attributes, in the format 'key1:value2 key2:value2'

parameters.name: search
parameters.description: A String contained in username, first or last name, or email. Default search behavior is prefix-based (e.g., foo or foo*). Use *foo* for infix search and "foo" for exact search.

parameters.name: username
parameters.description: A String contained in username, or the complete username, if param "exact" is true
